title: Understanding Stimulant Withdrawal Symptoms
text: Withdrawal from stimulants can lead to various physical and psychological symptoms. Consider what happens when the body is adjusting to the absence of stimulants.

title: Physical Symptoms of Withdrawal
text: Think about the physical discomforts that might occur when someone stops using stimulants. These can include muscle tension and headaches.

title: Psychological Symptoms of Withdrawal
text: Consider the emotional and mental state of a person withdrawing from stimulants. Depression and slower thinking are common psychological symptoms.

hintAnswer: muscle tension, headaches, stomach cramps, increased appetite, insomnia, depression, and slower thinking
title: Identifying Symptoms
text: List the symptoms that are commonly associated with stimulant withdrawal.
choices: muscle tension, headaches, stomach cramps, increased appetite, insomnia, depression, and slower thinking
apathy, dysphoria, psychomotor retardation or agitation, and impaired judgment
